Germany: Investiture Controversy: Pope Callixtus II and Holy Roman Emperor Henry V signed the Concordat of Worms, under which it was agreed that Holy Roman Emperors had the right to grant bishops secular authority but not religious authority.
Malta: Arab uprising against the Normans in Malta.
Slovenia: The first mention of Celje in the early Middle Ages under the name of Cylie in Admont's Chronicle. (to 1137)
Spain: Alfonso the Battler established the Confraternity of Belchite, a military order at Belchite devoted to war with Muslims.
